pageContext.claim: “The ones that love Trump ... like Meadows, Jordan, Gaetz, so many of them. … They're the ones that win with that. I mean it's like they don't even have an election. It's the ones that sort of they're a little shy about embracing what we're all about, they get clobbered.”
pageContext.analysis: Reps. Matt Gaetz, Jim Jordan and Mark Meadows represent conservative districts where it pays off to be pro-Trump. Republicans lost the House in 2018 partly because voters in swing districts repudiated Trump and his policies.
